grape.general_graph.GeneralGraph.degree_centralityÂ¶

GeneralGraph.degree_centrality()[source]Â¶

degree centrality measure of each node.

Returns:Nodeâs degree centrality attribute. Degree centrality is a simple centrality measure that counts how many neighbors a node has in an undirected graph. The more neighbors the node has the most important it is, occupying a strategic position that serves as a source or conduit for large volumes of flux transactions with other nodes. A node with high degree centrality is a node with many dependencies. TODO: it can be trivially parallelized (see single_source_shortest_path_parallel for the way to go )
Return type:float
